We've been asked to share:
Our hearts are heavy as we mourn the loss of our son, friend, teammate, Sanad Rabadi. He was a student at Marshall High School and was very involved whether he was playing on the basketball court or leading the student section for other games. He was not just a foreign exchange student...he was a friend to all and had a personality that lit up every room. To honor his life and the impact he had on so many people in his short time at Marshall, we ask that people join us on Wednesday, May 6, 2020 at 7:30 for a lantern sendoff at the new city pond near the Marshall square. There will be a table set up for people to check in and get a lantern. We will also have photo cards for people to write their favorite memories of Sanad or well wishes to his family. The cards will be sent to his family. We will try to provide as many lighters as possible but, if you are able to bring one, that would be greatly appreciated. Although this is a hard time for all of us, we ask that people practice social distancing the best they can. Please share this post and spread the word.

post_text: Just letting everyone know that the 2020 Alumni Banquet scheduled for April 11 has been postponed. With the fact that the school will be shut down during that time, with the Governor’s directive of “groups of 10 or less”, and with the fact that we could not dine in but could only offer take-out (which kind of negates the purpose of the banquet), we felt we had no choice. It was a difficult decision to make. We pray that the situation will be a whole lot better by April 11 but, given that many people will be planning reunions and needing to make travel plans, we feel it’s only fair to make the call now. We are in a difficult time and hope that everyone understands this decision. The new date will be announced as soon as it is known. Please stay safe and healthy.
